Ah yes, thankyou. Will mine work with primitives?[/quote]
In this case yes, because Integer implements the comparable class.

item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I just wrote this, it should work.

public boolean arrayContains(K[] arrayParam, K valueParam) { for(int i = 0; i < arrayParam.length; i++) { if(arrayParam[i].equals(valueParam)) return true; } return false; }

item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:6, topic:522957”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=641450.msg4321321#msg4321321 date=1372258827]
IIRC, the Arrays class has a ‘contains’ method

Arrays.contains(seq, val)
[/quote]
Nop. If you’re searching primitives the easiest way is a linear search[/quote]Right. I’m not sure what the implementation uses internally.

Edit: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Arrays.html#binarySearch(int[], int)
was what I’m thinking of.

item.title: Incompatible operand int and int[] (i.e. if (int == int[]) { }
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

You’re comparing two totally different data types, I’m not sure what programming background you have, but the java compiler will not implicitly call the first element in an array when not directly accessing elements.

With that being said, it’s unclear what you’re trying to do here. Are you trying to see if the “first” integer is in the “NUMBERS” array? Are you trying to see if the first element of “NUMBERS” equals “first” (which makes more sense considering the variable names)?

Edit: after rereading OP, “I’m trying to do something which finds out if the entered int is the same as the ints in my array”.
OK, so you want to compare a single integer to a array of them? What? That makes no sense.

Read full topic
item.source: Incompatible operand int and int[] (i.e. if (int == int[]) { }

item.title: Incompatible operand int and int[] (i.e. if (int == int[]) { }
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Didn’t know what to actually call this thread lmao

I’m trying to do something which finds out if the entered int is the same as the ints in my array i.e

[code=java]int first; //number entered by user
static final int[] NUMBERS = {1,2,3,4,5,6}; //array containing some numbers

if (first == NUMBERS) {
//process
}[/code]

How could I do something like this because that if statement would cause errors. I don’t want to change first into an array or change NUMBERS. Suggestions?

Read full topic
